Key Match Events: Pakistan demolished a previously unbeaten South Africa by 33 runs
Mohammed Haris hit three sixes in a remarkable 11-ball stay worth 28
Shadab Khan's effort was stunning, with four sixes from the 22 balls he faced for his 52
Shadab bowled the decisive over of the match, removing Temba Bavuma and Aiden Markram two balls apart
Post-Match Reflections: Babar Azam, Pakistan’s captain, said, “Cricket is a funny game, we hope for the best”
Shadab Khan said, “I’ve maybe done like this in the PSL, but this is an international match so definitely this is the best”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan remain third-favourites, after the Proteas and India, of getting one of the top two places in the group

If they are to make it through, they will need South Africa to slip up against the Netherlands, or India to do similar against Zimbabwe, then keep up their own end of the bargain by beating Bangladesh on Sunday
Others: Rain delayed the game after Shadab's over, with the Proteas far behind the Duckworth Lewis Stern par score
South Africa, who were missing David Miller because of a back injury, still have their fate in their own hands, with their final match coming against last-placed Netherlands
